required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: KETODEX for Emergence Delirium in Children Undergoing Outpatient Strabismus Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: KETODEX for Emergence Delirium in Children Undergoing Outpatient Strabismus Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Strabismus surgery for children is a very common procedure, with a high incidence of emergence delerium in the recovery room. A combination of intravenous ketamine/dexmedetomidine, or ketodex, has been previously shown to reduce emergence delerium in children undergoing adenotonsillectomy. Here, we study its application in strabismus surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Pediatric Anesthesia Emergence Delirium scale scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 6 hours in recovery room
primary_outcome.description: A low total score would indicate less emergence delirium

secondary_outcome.measure: wong-baker or numeric pain scores, depending on age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 6 hours in recovery room
secondary_outcome.description: A low total score would indicate less pain
time the patient is actually discharged from recovery room

arm_group.description: pediatric patients undergoing outpatient strabismus surgery, and not receiving ketodex
pediatric patients undergoing outpatient strabismus surgery, and receiving ketodex

study_pop.textblock: Healthy children, aged 0-18 years, undergoing outpatient strabismus surgery under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I/II children undergoing outpatient strabismus surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- anything not meeting the above

reference.citation: Hadi SM, Saleh AJ, Tang YZ, Daoud A, Mei X, Ouyang W. The effect of KETODEX on the incidence and severity of emergence agitation in children undergoing adenotonsillectomy using sevoflurane based-anesthesia. Int J Pediatr Otorhinolaryngol. 2015 May;79(5):671-6. doi: 10.1016/j.ijporl.2015.02.012. Epub 2015 Feb 19.
